title: Support query for computational reproducibility

labels.name: severity-wishlist
labels.description: feature request, or bugs that are very difficult to fix due to design issues

body:
We can already determine which file versions have been produced by a computation of some kind (see the metadata extractor for this https://github.com/datalad/datalad-metalad/blob/master/datalad_metalad/extractors/runprov.py). We can take this a step further and add functionality that can verify the computational reproducibility. Recipe:

- Find at all the files that look as if they could be computed
- Execute the computation
- Verify identical results
- Mark file version as `reproducible`

This can be done on a different machine to improve validity of the assessment

With that information we can enhance other commands:

- `get`: compute a file, if no external sources have it available for download
- `push`: exclude computable files, useful to minimize resource consumption (e.g. backups https://github.com/datalad/datalad/issues/16)
- `drop`: trim local clone by stripping computable files
